Hi,

I am currently developing using JUnit as my test harness. I was creating a
custom URL protocol handler and ran into problems. Ultimately I linked my
problems to JUnits custom classloader and I am able to dodge the issue by
using the text UI or using -noloading with the GUI.

The symptom I experienced was a class variable (static variable) that was
being initialised twice. This was frustrating since other constraints required
the use of static variables and thread-local storage.

My best analysis is that my first access to the class was handled by JUnits
classloader, but that the second access was handled by the default classloader
since it was loaded by code in rt.jar (namely the URL protocol handler
bootstrap mechanism). Since the second access used the default classloader,
the JUnit classloader was not queried to check if the class was already
loaded. The end result being that my static variable was reset to its default
value.

After reading about related bugs I realise that the general issue with the
classloader had already been discussed. I would like to know if there is
active development with respect to this issue and if it is likely to make it
into a pending release?

Thanks
Stewart
